data: You can use stickers to decorate the snapshots you take. Have fun and share your creations. You never know what you’ll find!
Some Pokémon can be placed above the ground. Drag the placement icon above the horizon line to place a Pokémon in the sky!
Use the group photo mode to take snapshots of your Pokémon together. Play with them to see how they react!
You can let up to three Pokémon out of their Poké Balls and take photos together. Use the group photo mode to capture the perfect shot of your pals!
Take photos with your Pokémon—anytime, anywhere!
You can let up to three Pokémon out of their Poké Balls and take photos together. You may even encounter a surprise while snapping some shots!
Find a flat surface and either tap the footprints or drag the Pokémon from the selection menu to place it.
You can return a Pokémon to its Poké Ball by tapping the recall button. You can then move your Pokémon to a new location.
Tap the rotate button to start using the toy, which you can move around to get your Pokémon’s attention.
Pokémon can only be placed on the ground while in landscape mode.
Pokémon cannot be placed in midair while in landscape mode.

This Pokémon can fuse with {0} to become {1}, or {2} to become {3}.
This Pokémon can unite with Glastrier to become Ice Rider Calyrex or Spectrier to become Shadow Rider Calyrex.
This Pokémon can fuse with Reshiram to become White Kyurem or Zekrom to become Black Kyurem.
This Pokémon can fuse with Solgaleo to become Dusk Mane Necrozma or Lunala to become Dawn Wings Necrozma.
This Pokémon can fuse with {0} or {1}.

Pokémon can separate for no cost.
Ice Rider Calyrex will separate into Glastrier and Calyrex.
Shadow Rider Calyrex will separate into Spectrier and Calyrex.
Black Kyurem will separate into Zekrom and Kyurem.
White Kyurem will separate into Reshiram and Kyurem.
Dawn Wings Necrozma will separate into Necrozma and Lunala.
Dusk Mane Necrozma will separate into Necrozma and Solgaleo.

Challenge a nearby Trainer by scanning their Battle Code.
Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! Have you happened to do any exploring today?
It’s quite the sight, let me tell you! It’s lousy with Bellsprout out there!
They tend to prefer hot and humid places, but right now they seem to be everywhere.
And you know, there’s still plenty for us to learn about the Flower Pokémon. Would you be a pal and catch one for us to study?
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%. And what a great specimen you’ve brought!
Did you know that despite their slender frames, they can move lightning fast to catch insects? One more reason to be glad we’re not bugs!
But there’s more for us to learn about this fascinating Pokémon! Drop by again after you’ve evolved your Bellsprout into Weepinbell.
I’ll leaf through my Weepinbell research notes so I’m ready for you when you get back!
Hey now, that’s got to be the Weepinbell of the ball! Let me take a closer look.
Aha! You see that large hook on its rear end? Weepinbell tend to use that to hook themselves on tree branches when they sleep.
In other words, if you see your Weepinbell yawning, find it a tree on the double!
But there’s no time for us to be snoozing. How about you evolve Weepinbell into a Victreebel and bring it back here?
Hey, you’re victree-orious! Vic-tree...riffic? Ahem. Let’s have a look at your Victreebell, %PLAYERNAME%.
These large, plant-like Pokémon live in huge colonies, deep within the jungle. No one who’s visited has returned to tell the tale. That’s sure foreboding!
Although if I put my professor cap on and think about it, how do we know about the colonies unless someone DID make it back?
There’s something to ponder! In the meantime, thanks for letting me observe your Victreebel. I’m sure you’ll be fast friends in no time—just watch out for that prey-dissolving acid!
Great to see you, %PLAYERNAME%! We’ve got all sorts of Pokémon to catch and research that needs doing. I can’t wait to get started!
Which of these fine feathered friends are you hoping to spot?
Master Ball available through Masterwork Research: Catching Wonders
This action cannot be undone. If you proceed, this Route will be completely lost and unrecoverable, and the appeal you submitted will not be reviewed.

If there are a lot of Routes in an area, only the top {0} Routes are highlighted to nearby Trainers. Which Routes are highlighted changes from day to day and may be impacted by these factors:
• ratings
• popularity
• age

Your decorated snapshot will be saved as a separate image. This will use up any stickers you applied.
To place a sticker, select it and then tap where you want it on the snapshot. Pinch the sticker to resize it. Tap the X to remove it.
Adjust stickers to suit your photo
You can use stickers to decorate the snapshots you take. Swipe up on the sticker panel at the bottom of the screen to select stickers.
Stickers placed on photos will be consumed once you save your picture. To return stickers to your inventory, tap "don't save" when prompted.
Hello, %PLAYERNAME%! It’s good to see you. I’ve got the loveliest news to share.
One of my research colleagues recently went on an excavation and came across some unusual diamonds.
The team suspects these aren’t just any diamonds, but ones created by the Jewel Pokémon Diancie!
My colleague is sending me samples, and I’m eager to examine them further.
While we wait for them to arrive, I’ll start prepping some dazzling facts about Diancie to share!
I’m afraid the samples from my colleague are still in transit, but I promised you Diancie trivia—and I won’t keep you on the edge of your Dian-seat.
Get this: Diancie can instantly create diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
Isn’t that just phenomenal? I wonder how their color and luster compare to other diamonds...
Great work out there, %PLAYERNAME%! You’ve earned a brain-teaser: which Pokémon is Diancie a sudden transformation of?
That’s right—Carbink! Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
That must be an astonishing sight. Do you think that queen is Diancie?
Well, as long as we’re still waiting for the samples to arrive, why don’t you explore the area and see if you can locate a Carbink for us to observe?
Here’s something you might not know—Carbink has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth!
I sure would love to “gleam” insights from such a long-lived Pokémon.
Anyway, I was just notified that the diamond samples from my colleague should be arriving very soon.
If they’re anything like Diancie itself, prepare yourself for the loveliest sight in the world!
The samples from my colleague are finally here!
After some testing, I’ve determined that these are indeed diamonds made by Diancie. Look at that shimmer!
These diamonds are rare, but catching a glimpse of Diancie is an even more extraordinary event.
Fun fact: Diancie is a Rock- and Fairy-type Pokémon—an unusual combination indeed!
Diancie can also Mega Evolve, making it shine even more brilliantly than ever. It really is one devastatingly dazzling Pokémon.
Thanks for helping me research Carbink and Diancie!
I always treasure our time together.
We may have spent the day discussing the glitz and glamor of a Mythical Pokémon, but you’re no less of a gem yourself.
Shines the light of a meteor. Attracts Pokémon found during the day and allows daytime evolutions.
Included rewards: • Premium in-game items, such as Rare Candies, Ultra Balls, and more • Extra encounters with Bellsprout and its Evolutions
Included rewards: • Premium in-game items, such as Rare Candies, Ultra Balls, and more • Extra encounters with Bounsweet and its Evolutions
Included bonus: • 2× Hatch Stardust Included rewards: • 1 Super Incubator and 1 Star Piece • 2,500 XP

A ticket to access daily bonus Field Research that rewards PokéCoins from May 16, 2024, at 12:00 a.m. to May 30, 2024, at 11:59 p.m. local time, wherever you are. If you purchase this ticket, every day from May 16 to May 30, you may receive a bonus Field Research the first time you log in each day. Please note: You must have three or fewer Field Research tasks active to be granted this bonus Field Research the first time you log on a given day! Also, you must claim the 20 PokéCoins reward after completing the task to receive it. You can learn more about bonus Field Research tasks here.

This ticket includes your choice of additional encounters with Spearow, Doduo, Hoothoot, Taillow, or Rufflet.

During the event, Pokémon encountered in this Timed Research have the same chance to be Shiny as those encountered via Field Research.

This Timed Research, which challenges you to complete Field Research tasks, will lead to encounters with the featured Pokémon of your choice! It will be available on May 11, 2024, from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time.
Included rewards: • 30,000 Stardust • 3 Rare Candies, 3 Rare Candy XL, 1 Star Piece

This ticket includes three Timed Research opportunities, which you will automatically get access to. Rewards include: - Poipole Helmet avatar item - An encounter with Poipole - Encounters with Beedrill, Galarian Slowpoke, Cacnea, Trubbish, and Skrelp - Encounters with Eevee and its Evolutions adorned with cherry blossoms - 3 Premium Battle Passes, 3 Incense, 15 Rare Candies, 3 Lucky Eggs, 3 Star Pieces, 30 Poipole Candies, and more - 60,000 XP and 30,000 Stardust Please note that if you purchase this version of the Wonder Ticket, you will not be able to purchase the version that comes with additional items. Information about these premium bonus items is available on our website.

This ticket includes three Timed Research opportunities, which you will automatically get access to as they become available. Purchasing this ticket will grant you access to the first and second Timed Research. Rewards for Part 1 and 2: - Poipole Helmet avatar item - Encounters with Beedrill, Galarian Slowpoke, and Cacnea - Encounters with Eevee and its Evolutions adorned with cherry blossoms - 2 Premium Battle Passes, 2 Incense, 5 Rare Candies, 2 Lucky Eggs, 2 Star Pieces, and more - 40,000 XP and 20,000 Stardust! Details about the third Timed Research opportunity and the premium rewards it includes will be revealed soon! Please note that if you purchase this version of the Wonder Ticket, you will not be able to purchase the version that comes with additional items. Information about these premium bonus items is available on our website.
